title: Finding the Slope of the Parallel Line
text: Because we know that parallel lines have the same slope, we need to find the slope of the original line. The equation is in slope-intercept form, so we know the slope is 3; this means that the slope of the parallel line is also $$3$$.

title: Solving for $$b$$
text: We now solve for $$b$$ in the equation $$y=3x+b$$. Plugging in the point $$(3,0)$$, we get $$0=9+b$$ --> $$b=-0$$. So, the final equation is $$y=3x-9$$
